sen.j: 島村 抱月（しまむら ほうげつ、1871年2月28日（明治4年1月10日 (旧暦)）- 1918年11月5日）は日本の文芸評論、演出家。
sen.e: Hogetsu SHIMAMURA (February 28, 1871 - November 5, 1918) was a Japanese literature critique and stage director.
Hougetsu SHIMAMURA (February 28, 1871 - November 5, 1918) was a Japanese literature critique and stage director.

sen.e: Hougetsu SHIMAMURA (February 28, 1871 - November 5, 1918) was a Japanese literature critique and stage director.

sen.j: 新劇運動の先駆けとなった。
sen.e: He was a pioneer in the shingeki (literary New Play) movement.
He was a pioneer in the shingeki (literary, new play) movement.
sen.cmt: 用語登録の訳に修正しました
sen.e: He was a pioneer in the shingeki (literary, new play) movement.

sen.j: 旧姓は佐々山､幼名は瀧太郎。
sen.e: His original family name was Sasayama and his childhood name was Takitaro.
His original family name was Sasayama and his childhood name was Takitaro.

sen.j: 小説、詩歌、戯曲などの実作もある。
sen.e: He also wrote novel, poem and drama.
He also wrote novels, poems and dramas.
He also wrote novels, poems and dramas.

sen.j: よって、劇作家、小説家、詩人でもある。
sen.e: Therefore he was a playwright, novelist and poet as well.

sen.j: 島根県小国村（現浜田市）に佐々山一平の長男として生まれ、浜田町裁判所検事島村文耕の養子となる。
sen.e: Hogetsu was born in Oguni-mura Village (today Hamada City) in Shimane Prefecture, as the first son of Ippei SASAYAMA and adopted by Bunko SHIMAMURA who was a public prosecutor at the court in Hamada-cho.

sen.e: Hougetsu was born in Oguni-mura Village (today Hamada City) in Shimane Prefecture, as the first son of Ippei SASAYAMA and adopted by Bunko SHIMAMURA who was a public prosecutor at the court in Hamada-cho.

sen.j: 1894年東京専門学校（早稲田大学）卒業後、｢早稲田文学｣記者､1898年読売新聞社会部主任となり母校文学部講師となる。
sen.e: After graduating from Tokyo Senmon Gakko (Waseda University) in 1894, he became a writer for "Waseda Bungaku" (Waseda Literature), then a supervisor at the local news section of the Yomiuri Shimbun Newspaper in 1898 and then a lecturer of the School of Letters, Arts and Sciences at his alma mater.

sen.cmt: 記号を修正しました読売新聞は正式名が「Shimbun」なのでそのように修正しました。

sen.j: 1902年から1905年まで、早稲田の海外留学生としてイギリスドイツ留学。
sen.e: From 1902 to 1905 he studied in England and Germany as a student sent by Waseda.
From 1902 to 1905 he studied in England and Germany as a student oversea sent by Waseda.

sen.j: 帰国後、早稲田大学文学部教授となり「早稲田文学」を主宰して自然主義運動のため大いに活躍する。
sen.e: After he came back to Japan, he became a professor of the School of Letters, Arts and Sciences at Waseda University and edited "Waseda Bungaku", actively involved in the naturalist movement.

sen.j: 1906年に坪内逍遥とともに文芸協会を設立。
sen.e: In 1906 he established the Bungei Kyokai (the Literary Society) together with Shoyo TSUBOUCHI.
In 1906, he established the Bungei Kyokai (the Literary Society) together with Shoyo TSUBOUCHI.

sen.j: しかし、1913年、松井須磨子との恋愛スキャンダルが起こり、文芸協会を脱退。
sen.e: In 1913, however, his love affair with Sumako MATSUI made him to leave the Bungei Kyokai.

sen.j: 同年、松井とともに芸術座 (劇団)を結成した。
sen.e: In the same year he formed the Geijutsuza (Arts Theater) with Matsui.

sen.j: トルストイの小説を基に抱月が脚色した「復活」（1914年）の舞台が評判になり、各地で興行を行った。
sen.e: The Geijutsuza had a great success with the production of Tolstoi's "Resurrection" (in 1914) dramatized by Shimamura, and went on tour all over Japan.

sen.j: 松井が歌う劇中歌「カチューシャの唄」は大ヒット曲になり、新劇の大衆化に貢献した。
sen.e: "Kachusha no Uta" (Katyusha's Song) sung by Matsui in the drama became a huge hit and contributed to the popularization of the shingeki.

sen.j: 1918年、抱月はスペインかぜにかかり急逝。
sen.e: In 1918 Hogetsu suddenly died from Spanish influenza.

sen.e: Matsui continued the performances of the Geijutsuza after Hogetsu's death, but subsequently she committed suicide to follow him.

sen.j: 2004年、東京都豊島区の豊島区史跡と同区の浄光寺に分骨埋葬されていた遺骨が故郷の島根県金城町（現・浜田市）へ里帰りした。
sen.e: In 2004 the cremains of Hogetsu, which had been buried separately at a historic site and Joko-ji Temple, both in Toshima Ward, were returned to his hometown, Kanagi-cho (today Hamada City) in Shimane Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 豊島区史跡の跡に「雑司が谷霊園」が抜けていると思います。また分骨の記述自体が間違っているようです。浄光寺は島根県にあり豊島区にはありません。個人のブログですが、ここに詳しく書かれています。http://hougetsu.jugem.jp/?eid=28

sen.j: 同霊園の墓はこれまで抱月の3女島村トシコ（東京都在住）が管理していたが、高齢のため管理が難しくなったこともあり、トシコから｢遺骨を里帰りさせたい｣と同町に打診があったという。
sen.e: Toshiko SHIMAMURA, Hogetsu's third daughter (living in Tokyo), who had been taking care of his grave in the cemetery, became difficult to do so due to old age, contacted Kanagi-cho as to her wish to have his cremains return to his hometown.
